feature: Add hover preview cards for wikilinks
description: Enhance HoverCard popups that show a preview of linked notes when hovering over wikilinks in the NoteViewer, similar to Wikipedia's preview feature. The current implementation exists but uses inefficient search-based resolution. This plan adds a dedicated API and improves the preview card UI.

subtasks.title: Refactor WikilinkPreview to use resolution API
subtasks.description: Update WikilinkPreview component in markdown.tsx to first resolve wikilink text to path using new API, then fetch preview. Handle broken links (resolution returns null)
subtasks.notes:
✓ Updated WikilinkPreview component to use new resolution API
✓ Changed imports to use resolveWikilink and getNotePreview
✓ Updated preview state and cache to use NotePreview type
✓ Refactored fetchPreview function to:
  - First call resolveWikilink() to get target path
  - Handle broken links (is_resolved=false or null target_path)
  - Then call getNotePreview() with resolved path
  - Cache NotePreview object instead of plain string
✓ Updated rendering to use preview.snippet
✓ Follows existing code patterns and TypeScript conventions
✓ Committed: e54a75f

subtasks.title: Update preview cache strategy
subtasks.description: Separate caches for resolution (linkText -> path) and previews (path -> previewData). Resolution cache can be longer-lived since paths rarely change
subtasks.notes:
✓ Separated caches into two distinct stores with different purposes:
  - resolutionCache: Map<string, string | null> - maps linkText to resolved path (longer-lived)
  - previewCache: Map<string, NotePreview> - maps path to preview data (can be invalidated more frequently)

✓ Updated fetchPreview logic to use two-stage caching:
  1. Check resolutionCache for linkText → path, fetch and cache if missing
  2. If resolved, check previewCache for path → preview, fetch and cache if missing
  3. Multiple wikilinks pointing to same note now share same preview data

✓ Benefits:
  - More efficient memory usage (deduplicated preview data)
  - Separation of concerns (resolution vs content)
  - Resolution cache can be longer-lived since paths rarely change
  - Preview cache can be invalidated independently when content changes

✓ Committed: ebd8213
